Package be.helha.api_recettapp.controllers

Class PaypalController

java.lang.Object
be.helha.api_recettapp.controllers.PaypalController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/paypal") @CrossOrigin(origins="http://localhost:4200") public class PaypalController extends Object
Controller class for handling PayPal-related endpoints.

This class provides an endpoint for creating and initiating PayPal payments by interacting with the PaypalService. This class uses annotation @RestController to indicate that this class is a Spring MVC controller where each method's return value is directly written to the HTTP response body. It uses annotation @RequestMapping("/paypal") to map HTTP requests to the "/paypal" URL path to methods in this controller.

    • PaypalController

      public PaypalController(PaypalService paypalService, IEntryService entryService, IContestService contestService, UserService userService)
      Constructs a new PaypalController.
      Parameters:
      paypalService - The PaypalService instance used to interact with the PayPal API.
      entryService - The EntryService instance used to interact with the Entry Service.
      contestService - The ContestService instance used to interact with the Contest Service.
      userService - The UserService instance used to interact with the Contest Service.

  • Method Details

    • pay

      @PostMapping("/pay") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Map<String,String>> pay(@RequestParam double total, @RequestBody Entry entry)
      Initiates a PayPal payment and returns the approval URL.

      This endpoint handles Post requests to the /pay path. It creates a payment with the specified total amount in USD and redirects the user to either a success or cancellation URL depending on the payment outcome.

      Parameters:
      total - The total amount for the payment in USD.
      entry - The entry to registered
      Returns:
      A String containing the approval URL for the user to complete the payment.

    • validatePayment

      @GetMapping("/validate") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Boolean> validatePayment(@RequestParam UUID uuid, @RequestParam String paymentId, @RequestParam String payerId)
      Validates a PayPal payment by checking the payment status using the provided payment ID and payer ID.

      This endpoint handles GET requests to the /validate path. It verifies if the payment was successfully completed by interacting with the PayPal service. The validation checks if the provided paymentId and payerId match a successful transaction.

      Parameters:
      paymentId - The unique PayPal payment ID associated with the payment.
      payerId - The PayPal payer ID associated with the payment.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a Boolean value indicating whether the payment was successful. If the payment is successful, it returns true, otherwise false.

    • savePaypalResponse

      @PostMapping("/response") public PaypalResponse savePaypalResponse(@RequestParam Long userId, @RequestBody String jsonResponse)
      Endpoint to save the PayPal response associated with a user.

      This endpoint receives a user ID and the PayPal response JSON, and it calls the service layer to save the PayPal response to the database. The PayPal response is associated with the user identified by the given user ID.

      The method accepts the user ID as a query parameter and the PayPal response JSON as the request body.

      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user to associate with the PayPal response.
      jsonResponse - The PayPal response JSON to be saved.
      Returns:
      The saved PaypalResponse entity.
